param.name: PTCH2SRV_TCONST
param.documentation: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved pitch angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_UP
param.documentation: Maximum pitch up rate that the pitch controller demands (degrees/sec) in ACRO mode.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RMAX_DN
param.documentation: This sets the maximum nose down pitch rate that the controller will demand (degrees/sec). Setting it to zero disables the limit.

param.name: PTCH2SRV_RLL
param.documentation: Gain added to pitch to keep aircraft from descending or ascending in turns. Increase in increments of 0.05 to reduce altitude loss. Decrease for altitude gain.

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
param.name: PTCH_RATE_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
param.name: PTCH_RATE_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: PTCH_RATE_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
param.name: PTCH_RATE_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
param.name: PTCH_RATE_FF
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: PTCH_RATE_FLTT
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: PTCH_RATE_FLTE
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: PTCH_RATE_FLTD
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: PTCH_RATE_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: Q_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables QuadPlane functionality, assuming multicopter motors start on output 5. If this is set to 2 then when starting AUTO mode it will initially be in VTOL AUTO mode.

param.name: Q_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle in all VTOL flight modes

param.name: Q_TRANSITION_MS
param.documentation: Transition time in milliseconds after minimum airspeed is reached

param.name: Q_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum ascending vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: Q_VELZ_MAX_DN
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s going down. If 0, uses Q_VELZ_MAX value.

param.name: Q_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

param.name: Q_RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the PWM refresh rate in Hz for QuadPlane quad motors

param.name: Q_THR_MIN_PWM
param.documentation: This is the minimum PWM output for the quad motors

param.name: Q_THR_MAX_PWM
param.documentation: This is the maximum PWM output for the quad motors

param.name: Q_ASSIST_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed below which the quad motors will provide stability and lift assistance in fixed wing modes. Zero means no assistance except during transition

param.name: Q_YAW_RATE_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum yaw rate for pilot input on rudder stick in degrees/second

param.name: Q_LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.name: Q_LAND_FINAL_ALT
param.documentation: The altitude at which we should switch to Q_LAND_SPEED descent rate

param.name: Q_TRAN_PIT_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum pitch during transition to auto fixed wing flight

param.name: Q_FRAME_CLASS
param.documentation: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

param.name: Q_FRAME_TYPE
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopter component

param.name: Q_VFWD_GAIN
param.documentation: Controls use of forward motor in vtol modes. If this is zero then the forward motor will not be used for position control in VTOL modes. A value of 0.05 is a good place to start if you want to use the forward motor for position control. No forward motor will be used in QSTABILIZE or QHOVER modes. Use QLOITER for position hold with the forward motor.

param.name: Q_WVANE_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls the tendency to yaw to face into the wind. A value of 0.1 is to start with and will give a slow turn into the wind. Use a value of 0.4 for more rapid response. The weathervaning works by turning into the direction of roll.

param.name: Q_WVANE_MINROLL
param.documentation: This set the minimum roll in degrees before active weathervaning will start. This may need to be larger if your aircraft has bad roll trim.

param.name: Q_RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The altitude which QRTL mode heads to initially

param.name: Q_RTL_MODE
param.documentation: If this is set to 1 then an RTL will change to QRTL when within RTL_RADIUS meters of the RTL destination, VTOL approach: vehicle will RTL at RTL alt and circle with a radius of Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD down to Q_RLT_ALT and then transission into the wind and QRTL, see 'AUTO VTOL Landing', QRTL Always: do a QRTL instead of RTL

param.name: Q_TILT_MASK
param.documentation: This is a bitmask of motors that are tiltable in a tiltrotor (or tiltwing). The mask is in terms of the standard motor order for the frame type.

param.name: Q_TILT_RATE_UP
param.documentation: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from forward flight to hover

param.name: Q_TILT_MAX
param.documentation: This is the maximum angle of the tiltable motors at which multicopter control will be enabled. Beyond this angle the plane will fly solely as a fixed wing aircraft and the motors will tilt to their maximum angle at the TILT_RATE

param.name: Q_GUIDED_MODE
param.documentation: This enables use of VTOL in guided mode. When enabled the aircraft will switch to VTOL flight when the guided destination is reached and hover at the destination.

param.name: Q_ESC_CAL
param.documentation: This is used to calibrate the throttle range of the VTOL motors. Please read https://ardupilot.org/plane/docs/quadplane-esc-calibration.html before using. This parameter is automatically set back to 0 on every boot. This parameter only takes effect in QSTABILIZE mode. When set to 1 the output of all motors will come directly from the throttle stick when armed, and will be zero when disarmed. When set to 2 the output of all motors will be maximum when armed and zero when disarmed. Make sure you remove all properllers before using.

param.name: Q_VFWD_ALT
param.documentation: Controls altitude to disable forward velocity assist when below this relative altitude. This is useful to keep the forward velocity propeller from hitting the ground. Rangefinder height data is incorporated when available.

param.name: Q_LAND_ICE_CUT
param.documentation: This controls stopping an internal combustion engine in the final landing stage of a VTOL. This is important for aircraft where the forward thrust engine may experience prop-strike if left running during landing. This requires the engine controls are enabled using the ICE_* parameters.

param.name: Q_ASSIST_ANGLE
param.documentation: This is the angular error in attitude beyond which the quadplane VTOL motors will provide stability assistance. This will only be used if Q_ASSIST_SPEED is also non-zero. Assistance will be given if the attitude is outside the normal attitude limits by at least 5 degrees and the angular error in roll or pitch is greater than this angle for at least Q_ASSIST_DELAY seconds. Set to zero to disable angle assistance.

param.name: Q_TILT_TYPE
param.documentation: This is the type of tiltrotor when TILT_MASK is non-zero. A continuous tiltrotor can tilt the rotors to any angle on demand. A binary tiltrotor assumes a retract style servo where the servo is either fully forward or fully up. In both cases the servo can't move faster than Q_TILT_RATE. A vectored yaw tiltrotor will use the tilt of the motors to control yaw in hover, Bicopter tiltrottor must use the tailsitter frame class (10)

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE
param.documentation: This is the pitch angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from VTOL control to fixed wing control.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_ANG_VT
param.documentation: This is the pitch angle at which tailsitter aircraft will change from fixed wing control to VTOL control, if zero Q_TAILSIT_ANGLE will be used

param.name: Q_TILT_RATE_DN
param.documentation: This is the maximum speed at which the motor angle will change for a tiltrotor when moving from hover to forward flight. When this is zero the Q_TILT_RATE_UP value is used.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_INPUT
param.documentation: This controls whether stick input when hovering as a tailsitter follows the conventions for fixed wing hovering or multicopter hovering. When PlaneMode is not enabled (bit0 = 0) the roll stick will roll the aircraft in earth frame and yaw stick will yaw in earth frame. When PlaneMode input is enabled, the roll and yaw sticks are swapped so that the roll stick controls earth-frame yaw and rudder controls earth-frame roll. When body-frame roll is enabled (bit1 = 1), the yaw stick controls earth-frame yaw rate and the roll stick controls roll in the tailsitter's body frame when flying level.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_MASK
param.documentation: This controls what channels have full manual control when hovering as a tailsitter and the Q_TAILSIT_MASKCH channel in high. This can be used to teach yourself to prop-hang a 3D plane by learning one or more channels at a time.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_MASKCH
param.documentation: This controls what input channel will activate the Q_TAILSIT_MASK mask. When this channel goes above 1700 then the pilot will have direct manual control of the output channels specified in Q_TAILSIT_MASK. Set to zero to disable.

param.humanName: Tailsitter vector thrust gain in forward flight
param.name: Q_TAILSIT_VFGAIN
param.documentation: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in forward flight for a vectored tailsitter

param.humanName: Tailsitter vector thrust gain in hover
param.name: Q_TAILSIT_VHGAIN
param.documentation: This controls the amount of vectored thrust control used in hover for a vectored tailsitter

param.humanName: Tilt minimum angle for vectored yaw
param.name: Q_TILT_YAW_ANGLE
param.documentation: This is the angle of the tilt servos when in VTOL mode and at minimum output. This needs to be set for Q_TILT_TYPE=3 to enable vectored control for yaw of tricopter tilt quadplanes. This is also used to limit the forwards travel of bicopter tilts when in VTOL modes

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_VHPOW
param.documentation: This controls the amount of extra pitch given to the vectored control when at high pitch errors

param.name: Q_MAV_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls the mavlink type given in HEARTBEAT messages. For some GCS types a particular setting will be needed for correct operation.

param.name: Q_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Level Transition:Keep wings within LEVEL_ROLL_LIMIT and only use forward motor(s) for climb during transition, Allow FW Takeoff: If bit is not set then NAV_TAKEOFF command on quadplanes will instead perform a NAV_VTOL takeoff, Allow FW Land:If bit is not set then NAV_LAND command on quadplanes will instead perform a NAV_VTOL_LAND, Vtol Takeoff Frame: command NAV_VTOL_TAKEOFF altitude is as set by the command's reference frame rather than a delta above current location, Use FW Approach:Use a fixed wing approach for VTOL landings, USE QRTL:instead of QLAND for rc failsafe when in VTOL modes, Use Governor:Use ICE Idle Governor in MANUAL for forward motor, Force Qassist: on always,Mtrs_Only_Qassist: in tailsitters only, uses VTOL motors and not flying surfaces for QASSIST, Airmode_On_Arm:Airmode enabled when arming by aux switch, Disarmed Yaw Tilt:Enable motor tilt for yaw when disarmed, Delay Spoolup:Delay VTOL spoolup for 2 seconds after arming, ThrLandControl: enable throttle stick control of landing rate, DisableApproach: Disable use of approach and airbrake stages in VTOL landing, EnableLandResponsition: enable pilot controlled repositioning in AUTO land. Descent will pause while repositioning.
param.field: 0:Level Transition,1:Allow FW Takeoff,2:Allow FW Land,3:Vtol Takeoff Frame,4:Use FW Approach,5:Use QRTL,6:Use Governor,7:Force Qassist,8:Mtrs_Only_Qassist,9:Airmode_On_Arm,10:Disarmed Yaw Tilt,11:Delay Spoolup,12:disable Qassist based on synthetic airspeed,13:Disable Ground Effect Compensation,14:Ignore forward flight angle limits in Qmodes,15:ThrLandControl,16:DisableApproach,17:EnableLandResponsition

param.name: Q_TRANS_DECEL
param.documentation: This is deceleration rate that will be used in calculating the stopping distance when transitioning from fixed wing flight to multicopter flight.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_GSCMAX
param.documentation: Maximum gain scaling for tailsitter Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK options

param.name: Q_TRIM_PITCH
param.documentation: This sets the compensation for the pitch angle trim difference between forward and vertical flight pitch, NOTE! this is relative to forward flight trim not mounting locaiton. For tailsitters this is relative to a baseline of 90 degrees.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_RLL_MX
param.documentation: Maximum Allowed roll angle for tailsitters. If this is zero then Q_ANGLE_MAX is used.

param.humanName: Quadplane fixed wing landing approach radius
param.name: Q_FW_LND_APR_RAD
param.documentation: This provides the radius used, when using a fixed wing landing approach. If set to 0 then the WP_LOITER_RAD will be selected.

param.name: Q_TRANS_FAIL
param.documentation: Maximum time allowed for forward transitions, exceeding this time will cancel the transition and the aircraft will immediately change to QLAND. 0 for no limit.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_MOTMX
param.documentation: Bitmask of motors to remain active in forward flight for a 'Copter' tailsitter. Non-zero indicates airframe is a Copter tailsitter and uses copter style motor layouts determined by Q_FRAME_CLASS and Q_FRAME_TYPE. This should be zero for non-Copter tailsitters.

param.name: Q_THROTTLE_EXPO
param.documentation: Amount of curvature in throttle curve: 0 is linear, 1 is cubic

param.name: Q_ACRO_RLL_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum roll rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

param.name: Q_ACRO_PIT_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum pitch rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

param.name: Q_ACRO_YAW_RATE
param.documentation: The maximum yaw rate at full stick deflection in QACRO mode

param.name: Q_TKOFF_FAIL_SCL
param.documentation: Scalar for how long past the expected takeoff time a takeoff should be considered as failed and the vehicle will switch to QLAND. If set to 0 there is no limit on takeoff time.

param.name: Q_TKOFF_ARSP_LIM
param.documentation: Airspeed limit during takeoff. If the airspeed exceeds this level the vehicle will switch to QLAND. This is useful for ensuring that you don't takeoff into excessively strong wind. If set to 0 there is no limit on airspeed during takeoff.

param.name: Q_ASSIST_ALT
param.documentation: This is the altitude below which quadplane assistance will be triggered. This acts the same way as Q_ASSIST_ANGLE and Q_ASSIST_SPEED, but triggers if the aircraft drops below the given altitude while the VTOL motors are not running. A value of zero disables this feature. The altutude is calculated as being above ground level. The height above ground is given from a Lidar used if available and RNGFND_LANDING=1. Otherwise it comes from terrain data if TERRAIN_FOLLOW=1 and comes from height above home otherwise.

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK
param.documentation: Bitmask of gain scaling methods to be applied: Throttle: scale gains with throttle, ATT_THR: reduce gain at high throttle/tilt, 2:Disk theory velocity calculation, requires Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD to be set, ATT_THR must not be set, 3:Altitude correction, scale with air density

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_GSCMIN
param.documentation: Minimum gain scaling for tailsitter Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK options

param.name: Q_ASSIST_DELAY
param.documentation: This is delay between the assistance thresholds being met and the assistance starting.

param.humanName: VTOL manual forward throttle max percent
param.name: Q_FWD_MANTHR_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum value for manual forward throttle; used with RC option FWD_THR (209)

param.name: Q_TAILSIT_DSKLD
param.documentation: This is the vehicle weight in kg divided by the total disk area of all propellers in m^2. Only used with Q_TAILSIT_GSCMSK = 4

param.name: Q_TILT_FIX_ANGLE
param.documentation: This is the angle the motors tilt down when at maximum output for forward flight. Set this to a non-zero value to enable vectoring for roll/pitch in forward flight on tilt-vectored aircraft

param.name: Q_TILT_FIX_GAIN
param.documentation: This is the gain for use of tilting motors in fixed wing flight for tilt vectored quadplanes

param.humanName: Tailsitter VTOL to forward flight transition rate
param.name: Q_TAILSIT_RAT_FW
param.documentation: The pitch rate at which tailsitter aircraft will pitch down in the transition from VTOL to forward flight

param.humanName: Tailsitter forward flight to VTOL transition rate
param.name: Q_TAILSIT_RAT_VT
param.documentation: The pitch rate at which tailsitter aircraft will pitch up in the transition from forward flight to VTOL

param.name: Q_AUTOTUNE_AXES
param.documentation: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

param.name: Q_AUTOTUNE_AGGR
param.documentation: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

param.name: Q_AUTOTUNE_MIN_D
param.documentation: Defines the minimum D gain

param.name: Q_A_SLEW_YAW
param.documentation: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

param.name: Q_A_ACCEL_Y_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in yaw axis

param.name: Q_A_RATE_FF_ENAB
param.documentation: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

param.name: Q_A_ACCEL_R_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in roll axis

param.name: Q_A_ACCEL_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in pitch axis

param.name: Q_A_ANGLE_BOOST
param.documentation: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

param.humanName: Roll axis angle controller P gain
param.name: Q_A_ANG_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain
param.name: Q_A_ANG_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain
param.name: Q_A_ANG_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

param.humanName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
param.name: Q_A_ANG_LIM_TC
param.documentation: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

param.name: Q_A_RATE_R_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

param.name: Q_A_RATE_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

param.name: Q_A_RATE_Y_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

param.name: Q_A_INPUT_TC
param.documentation: Attitude control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_D
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FF
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTT
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTE
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_FLTD
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: Q_A_RAT_RLL_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FF
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller feed forward

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTT
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTE
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_FLTD
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: Q_A_RAT_PIT_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FF
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller feed forward

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTT
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTE
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_FLTD
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: Q_A_RAT_YAW_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: Q_A_THR_MIX_MIN
param.documentation: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

param.name: Q_A_THR_MIX_MAX
param.documentation: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

param.name: Q_A_THR_MIX_MAN
param.documentation: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

param.name: Q_LOIT_ANG_MAX
param.documentation: Loiter maximum lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of PSC_ANGLE_MAX or ANGLE_MAX

param.name: Q_LOIT_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

param.name: Q_LOIT_ACC_MAX
param.documentation: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

param.name: Q_LOIT_BRK_ACCEL
param.documentation: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

param.name: Q_LOIT_BRK_JERK
param.documentation: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

param.name: Q_LOIT_BRK_DELAY
param.documentation: Loiter brake start delay (in seconds)

param.name: Q_M_YAW_HEADROOM
param.documentation: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

param.name: Q_M_THST_EXPO
param.documentation: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

param.name: Q_M_SPIN_MAX
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

param.name: Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MAX
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: Q_M_BAT_VOLT_MIN
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: Q_M_BAT_CURR_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

param.name: Q_M_PWM_TYPE
param.documentation: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

param.name: Q_M_PWM_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN

param.name: Q_M_PWM_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX

param.name: Q_M_SPIN_MIN
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

param.name: Q_M_SPIN_ARM
param.documentation: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

param.name: Q_M_BAT_CURR_TC
param.documentation: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

param.name: Q_M_THST_HOVER
param.documentation: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

param.name: Q_M_HOVER_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

param.humanName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
param.name: Q_M_SAFE_DISARM
param.documentation: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed

param.name: Q_M_YAW_SV_ANGLE
param.documentation: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle

param.name: Q_M_SPOOL_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

param.name: Q_M_BOOST_SCALE
param.documentation: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle. The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

param.name: Q_M_BAT_IDX
param.documentation: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

param.humanName: Output slew time for increasing throttle
param.name: Q_M_SLEW_UP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

param.humanName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle
param.name: Q_M_SLEW_DN_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

param.humanName: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.
param.name: Q_M_SAFE_TIME
param.documentation: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

param.name: Q_P_ACC_XY_FILT
param.documentation: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

param.name: Q_P_POSZ_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: Q_P_VELZ_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: Q_P_VELZ_I
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Q_P_VELZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Q_P_VELZ_D
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Q_P_VELZ_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller Feed Forward gain. Produces an output that is proportional to the magnitude of the target

param.name: Q_P_VELZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) error filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.humanName: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term
param.name: Q_P_VELZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D terms

param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_P
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_I
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_D
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_FF
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller feed forward

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_FLTT
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: Q_P_ACCZ_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: Q_P_POSXY_P
param.documentation: Position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_D
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_FILT
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_D_FILT
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: Q_P_VELXY_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: Q_P_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request. Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

param.humanName: Time constant for the horizontal kinimatic input shaping
param.name: Q_P_TC_XY
param.documentation: Time constant of the horizontal kinimatic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

param.humanName: Time constant for the vertical kinimatic input shaping
param.name: Q_P_TC_Z
param.documentation: Time constant of the vertical kinimatic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

param.name: Q_WP_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

param.name: Q_WP_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: Q_WP_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

param.name: Q_WP_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

param.name: Q_WP_ACCEL
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: Q_WP_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.humanName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
param.name: Q_WP_RFND_USE
param.documentation: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

param.name: Q_WP_JERK
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

param.name: RALLY_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of rally points currently loaded

param.name: RALLY_LIMIT_KM
param.documentation: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

param.name: RALLY_INCL_HOME
param.documentation: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

param.name: RC_OVERRIDE_TIME
param.documentation: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

param.name: RC_OPTIONS
param.documentation: RC input options
param.field: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe bit but allow other RC failsafes if setup, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yay sticks, 7:Allow Switch reverse, 8:Use passthrough for CRSF telemetry

param.name: RC_PROTOCOLS
param.documentation: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

param.name: RC10_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

param.name: RC10_DZ
param.documentation: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

param.name: RC10_OPTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this RC channel

param.name: RC11_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC11_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC11_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC11_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

param.name: RC11_DZ
param.documentation: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

param.name: RC11_OPTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this RC channel

param.name: RC12_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC12_TRIM

param.name: RC12_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC12_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_DEFAULT
param.documentation: The state of the relay on boot.

param.name: RELAY_PIN5
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 5th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN6
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 6th relay control.

param.name: RLL2SRV_TCONST
param.documentation: Time constant in seconds from demanded to achieved roll angle. Most models respond well to 0.5. May be reduced for faster responses, but setting lower than a model can achieve will not help.

param.name: RLL2SRV_RMAX
param.documentation: Maximum roll rate that the roll controller demands (degrees/sec) in ACRO mode.

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
param.name: RLL_RATE_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
param.name: RLL_RATE_I
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: RLL_RATE_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: RLL_RATE_D
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
param.name: RLL_RATE_FF
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: RLL_RATE_FLTT
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: RLL_RATE_FLTE
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: RLL_RATE_FLTD
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: RLL_RATE_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: RNGFND1_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND1_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.name: RNGFND1_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: RNGFND1_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

param.name: RNGFND1_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: RNGFND1_MIN_CM
param.documentation: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND1_MAX_CM
param.documentation: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND1_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

param.name: RNGFND1_RMETRIC
param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.name: RNGFND1_PWRRNG
param.documentation: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

param.humanName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
param.name: RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR
param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND1_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_ORIENT
param.documentation: Orientation of rangefinder

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF
param.documentation: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ
param.documentation: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_AVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_THR
param.documentation: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_BAUD
param.documentation: Desired baud rate

param.name: RNGFND2_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND2_PIN

param.documentation: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

param.humanName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
param.name: RNGFND4_GNDCLEAR
param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND4_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

param.name: RNGFND4_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND4_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND4_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND4_ORIENT
param.documentation: Orientation of rangefinder

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_MAVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_MEDF
param.documentation: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_FRQ
param.documentation: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_AVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_THR
param.documentation: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_BAUD
param.documentation: Desired baud rate

param.name: RNGFND5_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND5_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.name: RNGFND5_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: RNGFND5_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

param.name: RNGFND5_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: RNGFND5_MIN_CM
param.documentation: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND5_MAX_CM
param.documentation: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND5_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

param.name: RNGFND5_RMETRIC
param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.documentation: Minimum data quality to be used

param.documentation: Which pin to use

param.name: RSSI_TYPE
param.documentation: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

param.name: RSSI_ANA_PIN
param.documentation: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

param.name: RSSI_PIN_LOW
param.documentation: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH

param.name: RSSI_PIN_HIGH
param.documentation: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW

param.name: RSSI_CHANNEL
param.documentation: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_LOW
param.documentation: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_HIGH
param.documentation: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: SCHED_LOOP_RATE
param.documentation: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

param.name: SCHED_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

param.name: SCR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls if scripting is enabled

param.name: SCR_VM_I_COUNT
param.documentation: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

param.name: SCR_HEAP_SIZE
param.documentation: Amount of memory available for scripting

param.name: SCR_DEBUG_LVL
param.documentation: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

param.name: SCR_USER1
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER2
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER3
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER4
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_DIR_DISABLE
param.documentation: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

param.name: SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL0_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the console.

param.name: SERIAL1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL1_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL2_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL3_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL4_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL4_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial4. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL5_PROTOCOL

param.name: SERIAL5_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial5. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL6_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial6 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL6_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial6. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL1_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL3_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL4_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL5_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL6_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL_PASS1
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASS2
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASSTIMO
param.documentation: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

param.name: SERIAL7_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial7 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL7_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial7. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL7_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL8_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial8 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL8_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial7. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL8_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERVO_AUTO_TRIM
param.documentation: This enables automatic servo trim in flight. Servos will be trimed in stabilized flight modes when the aircraft is close to level. Changes to servo trim will be saved every 10 seconds and will persist between flights. The automatic trim won't go more than 20% away from a centered trim.

param.name: SERVO_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_ESC
param.documentation: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

param.name: SERVO10_MIN
param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_MAX
param.documentation: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_TRIM
param.documentation: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

param.name: SERVO10_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

param.humanName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors
param.name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
param.documentation: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
param.documentation: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
param.documentation: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

param.name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
param.documentation: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
param.documentation: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

param.name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
param.documentation: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

param.humanName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels
param.name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
param.documentation: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
param.documentation: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

param.name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

param.humanName: Is the soaring mode enabled or not
param.name: SOAR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Toggles the soaring mode on and off

param.name: SOAR_VSPEED
param.documentation: Rate of climb to trigger themalling speed

param.name: SOAR_Q1
param.documentation: Standard deviation of noise in process for strength

param.name: SOAR_Q2
param.documentation: Standard deviation of noise in process for position and radius

param.name: SOAR_R
param.documentation: Standard deviation of noise in measurement

param.name: SOAR_DIST_AHEAD
param.documentation: Initial guess of the distance to the thermal center

param.name: SOAR_MIN_THML_S
param.documentation: Minimum number of seconds to spend thermalling

param.name: SOAR_MIN_CRSE_S
param.documentation: Minimum number of seconds to spend cruising

param.name: SOAR_POLAR_CD0
param.documentation: Zero lift drag coefficient

param.name: SOAR_POLAR_B
param.documentation: Induced drag coeffient

param.name: SOAR_POLAR_K
param.documentation: Cl factor 2*m*g/(rho*S)

param.humanName: Maximum soaring altitude, relative to the home location
param.name: SOAR_ALT_MAX
param.documentation: Don't thermal any higher than this.

param.humanName: Minimum soaring altitude, relative to the home location
param.name: SOAR_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Don't get any lower than this.

param.humanName: Maximum power altitude, relative to the home location
param.name: SOAR_ALT_CUTOFF
param.documentation: Cut off throttle at this alt.

param.humanName: (Optional) Maximum drift distance to allow when thermalling.
param.name: SOAR_MAX_DRIFT
param.documentation: The previous mode will be restored if the horizontal distance to the thermalling start location exceeds this value. -1 to disable.

param.name: SOAR_MAX_RADIUS
param.documentation: RTL will be entered when a thermal is exited and the plane is more than this distance from home. -1 to disable.

param.name: SOAR_THML_BANK
param.documentation: This parameter sets the bank angle to use when thermalling. Typically 30 - 45 degrees works well.
